div.class: fsElement fsCalendar fsSlideshow home-calendar fsItemCount_15 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.a: Free Virtual Parenting Classes hosted by MCC

div.div:
Virtually join Jackie Rhew for this virtual parenting series, designed to support parents during this challenging time of eLearning, transitions, highs and lows. Each parenting session will offer new topics, tips and resources. The first one is this Saturday, she will be focusing on how to provide critical social and emotional help to children during this time of uncertainty. Information can be found in the links below.
April 30, 2020 2:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m.
May 07, 2020 6:00 p.m.- 7:00 p.m.
**This complimentary class will be delivered live through Zoom. A secured email link will be sent to you 24 hours before each class. You must register with valid email address to receive the link**
For further information on the Community Education programs at MCC, please contact Tricia Johnson at tjohnson935@mchenry.edu.
https://lnkd.in/euryVcB
https://lnkd.in/eMJUycx

article.a: Read More about Free Virtual Parenting Classes hosted by MCC

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-2 fsTag-90 fsTag-92 fsTag-124 fsTag-125 fsTag-126 fsTag-127 fsFeaturedPost

img.alt: D155 Students Partner with Project Front Line: McHenry County COVID-19 Support

div.a: D155 Students Partner with Project Front Line: McHenry County COVID-19 Support

div.p: Art students across district 155 have partnered with Project Front Line, a grassroots coronavirus relief effort, to design thank you notes for front line workers across McHenry County during the COVID-19 pandemic.

article.a: Read More about D155 Students Partner with Project Front Line: McHenry County COVID-19 Support

img.alt: Graduation Updates for the Class of 2020

div.a: Graduation Updates for the Class of 2020

div.p: D155 high schools will host a Friday Night Lights parade for seniors and their families to honor the Class of 2020 on Friday evening, May 15. The formal graduation ceremony is rescheduled for Saturday, July 25, 2020. We are hopeful that by late July we can gather, pending guidelines from the Governor, CDC and the Illinois Department of Public Health.

article.a: Read More about Graduation Updates for the Class of 2020

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-2 fsTag-90 fsTag-92 fsTag-124 fsTag-125 fsTag-126 fsTag-127 fsFeaturedPost

img.alt: An Interview with D155 Graduate Dr. Emily Landon

div.a: An Interview with D155 Graduate Dr. Emily Landon

div.p: Emily Landon, MD, graduated from Crystal Lake Central High School in 1995. She is now the Executive Medical Director of Infection Prevention and Control at UChicago Medicine and has gained popularity for her impassioned speech at Governor Pritzker’s COVID-19 press conference on March 20.

article.a: Read More about An Interview with D155 Graduate Dr. Emily Landon

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-2 fsTag-90 fsTag-92 fsTag-124 fsTag-125 fsTag-126 fsTag-127 fsFeaturedPost

div.p: D155 recognizes our responsibility to contain the spread and mitigate the impact of coronavirus (COVID-19). We continue to closely monitor the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, and we are following guidance from the Illinois Department of Public Health and the McHenry County Department of Health as we make decisions. We understand it’s a fluid situation and we will provide timely communication to staff, students, parents, and our community as we receive updates.
The safety and well-being of our students and staff remains our top priority. We are working to develop an FAQ and provide you more information about the district’s plan moving forward.

li.p: Stay home if you are sick until at least 24 hours after your fever* (temperature of 100 degrees Fahrenheit or 37.8 degrees Celsius or higher) is gone.
Temperature should be measured without the use of fever-reducing medicines (medicines that contain ibuprofen or acetaminophen).

div.p: As a parent or guardian, you ultimately make the decision to keep your child home. If you choose not to send your child to school, please call the attendance line to have your child’s absence recorded as excused.

div.div: of Graduates from the Class of 2019 are Continuing their Education
Earned in scholarships by the Class of 2019

div.p: Teachers with Master's Degree or Higher

ul.li: 1 S. Virginia Rd. Crystal Lake, IL 60014

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: Remote Learning: After the Governor’s announcement April 17, we, like many of you, are disappointed that our school year will end remotely. As we continue to do our part to prevent the spread of COVID-19 by social distancing, we will continue remote learning days through the end of the school year. April 24 and May 1 will be days of non-attendance for students while teachers and staff engage in professional development. Teachers will not post assignments on April 24 or May 1.

hr.p: Graduation Information: D155 high schools will host a Friday Night Lights parade for seniors and their families to honor the Class of 2020 on Friday evening, May 15.

The formal graduation ceremony is rescheduled for Saturday, July 25, 2020. We are hopeful that by late July we can gather, pending guidelines from the Governor, CDC and the Illinois Department of Public Health.

Meal Distribution: Meals will continue to be available for pick-up at Crystal Lake Central High School, located at 45 W. Franklin Ave. in Crystal Lake (field house entrance off of Walkup). Food will be provided from 7:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. on Tuesdays (May 5, 12, & 19).
